poem:
Title: Unexpected Revelation

Unclenching suspicion, she glimpsed my secret - blue.
Sparking doubt, mistrust, a fearsome brew.
Her faith, unmoored, in a tumult sway,
My love, my desire - called to fray. 
Not less a man, nor weak in stride, 
In pill-blue hope, my nerves I bide.
Understand, dear heart, beneath the sordid, lurks the true,
In passion's dance, desire is simply my love for you.
